meta.title: World of Tetris: Fragments of the Sleepless Realm

sections.title: What Is This Game?
sections.text: World of Tetris is a puzzle game where pressure, not speed alone, defines difficulty. You are not fighting blocks â€” you are fighting rising tension.

sections.title: Goal
sections.text: The goal is to progress through 100 levels and break the curse placed upon the Sleepless Realm.

sections.title: Game Over
sections.text: The game ends when new pieces can no longer enter the field. Failure is expected and part of learning.

sections.title: Movement
sections.text: Move pieces left and right using Arrow keys or A / D.

sections.title: Rotation
sections.text: Rotate pieces using Arrow Up or W.

sections.title: Soft Drop
sections.text: Soft Drop accelerates falling without locking the piece in place.

sections.title: Hard Drop
sections.text: Hard Drop instantly places the piece, rewarding confidence and precision.

sections.title: Hold
sections.text: Hold saves the current piece for later use. Activate with Shift or Ctrl.

sections.title: Pause
sections.text: Pause the game using P or Escape. Use this time to breathe and think.

sections.title: Line Clears
sections.text: Clearing lines is the primary way to score points. Multiple lines grant higher rewards.

sections.title: Combos
sections.text: Consecutive line clears form combos. Combos reduce pressure and significantly increase score.

sections.title: Soft vs Hard Drop
sections.text: Soft Drop offers control and safety. Hard Drop rewards decisiveness but carries higher risk.

sections.title: What Is Pressure?
sections.text: Pressure is a hidden variable representing tension. It rises with mistakes and falls with skilled play.

sections.title: Increasing Pressure
sections.text: Pressure increases from holes, high stacks, slow decisions, and repeated errors.

sections.title: Reducing Pressure
sections.text: Clearing lines, performing combos, and decisive actions reduce pressure.

sections.title: Levels and Tiers
sections.text: Levels represent story progress. Difficulty Tiers represent mechanical challenge.

sections.title: Difficulty Multipliers
sections.text: Easy Ã—0.5, Normal Ã—1.0, Hard Ã—1.5, Hardcore Ã—2.0. Normal is the intended experience.

sections.title: What Difficulty Changes
sections.text: Difficulty multiplies pressure gain, pressure reduction, fall speed, reaction windows, and antagonist activity.

sections.title: Hero Philosophy
sections.text: Heroes represent different approaches to managing pressure and correcting mistakes.

sections.title: Warrior
sections.text: Stable and reliable. Focuses on consistency and error reduction.

sections.title: Mage
sections.text: Controls the field by removing or reshaping blocks.

sections.title: Healer
sections.text: Repairs mistakes by filling gaps and smoothing dangerous structures.

sections.title: Berserker
sections.text: Thrives under pressure. Gains power as tension rises.

sections.title: Rogue â€” The Laughing Archer
sections.text: A trickster who thrives in chaos. Uses humor, precision shots, and provocation to disrupt both the field and the Black Baron.

sections.title: Rogue Abilities
sections.text: Rogue can shoot blocks, pierce lines, interrupt enemy spells, and taunt the Black Baron into making mistakes.

sections.title: Pet System
sections.text: Pets are passive companions inspired by JRPG systems. They assist automatically and never replace player skill.

sections.title: Cat
sections.text: Focus: Intelligence. Anticipates risky placements and reduces pressure from potential mistakes.

sections.title: Dog
sections.text: Focus: Defense. Stabilizes pressure spikes and reduces punishment from errors.

sections.title: Fox
sections.text: Focus: Speed. Reduces cooldowns and improves reaction windows at high difficulty.

sections.title: Bear
sections.text: Focus: Strength. Amplifies positive actions such as combos and line clears.

sections.title: Who Is the Black Baron?
sections.text: The Black Baron is a reactive antagonist who reflects player performance rather than creating difficulty.

sections.title: Anger System
sections.text: The Baron possesses an Anger meter. As Anger rises, he loses composure and begins to make mistakes.

sections.title: Loss of Control
sections.text: At high Anger levels, the Baron's interventions may misfire, occasionally helping the player instead of hindering them.

sections.title: What Is Taunt?
sections.text: Taunt is a psychological mechanic inspired by RPGs. It provokes the Black Baron, increasing his Anger.

sections.title: Mocking Shot
sections.text: Rogue's taunt ability fires a mocking shot that disrupts the Baron's concentration.

sections.title: Risk and Reward
sections.text: Taunting is risky. It creates windows of opportunity but can backfire if misused.
